messages.subject: quotes was (Re: adequate education)
messages.msgSnippet: In school you get the lesson and then take the test ... In life you take the test and then get the lesson. -- Unknown Source When it is dark enough, you can
messages.messageBody:
In school you get the lesson and then take the test ...
In life you take the test and then get the lesson."
-- Unknown Source

"When it is dark enough, you can see the stars."
-- Charles Beard

"The period of greatest gain in knowledge and experience is the
most difficult period in one's life."
-- Dalai Lama

"Out of clutter, find Simplicity.
From discord, find Harmony.
In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity."
-- Albert Einstein


my quote

"actually, the only way to learn is to live it"

messages.subject: adequate education
messages.msgSnippet: maybe this is a little off, but I read a book Rich dad, Poor dad , (sounds out a place i know), where the author asks the question generally about good
messages.messageBody:
maybe this is a little off, but I read a book "Rich dad, Poor dad",
(sounds out 'a place i know), where the author asks the question
generally about good educations, "May it's a good education, but is
it adequate?" - this got me thinking because what he stated was
about successful financial education and view of money, ironically
most people focus on money when they think about success; so here's
a thing for you to ponder about
